context.title: Composed Box
context.description: This is a Composed Box, a Box that can contain multiple Boxes, Ports, as many as you want.

context.title: Instance Box
context.description: This is an Instance Box, a powerful Box that you can use to represent the "concept" of other Composed Boxes that you made, without copying all the design of this Composed Boxes, only instantiating them.

context.title: Cast Box
context.description: This is a Cast Box, that converts an input type to another type, and throws it to the box output.

context.title: Port
context.description: A Port is an element that provides a connection point to the data.

context.title: Constant Box
context.description: A Constant Box is a specific box that give us a constant value.

context.title: Count Box
context.description: A Count Box is a simple counter, like a clock.

context.title: Timeout Box
context.description: A Timeout Box is like a "count-down" timer, it says you when the time specified has passed.

context.title: HighLow Box
context.description: HighLow Box is simply a threshold between 2 values, and it says if the value entered is over or below this 2 values.

context.title: Remote Box
context.description: Remote Box is an I/O Box to get or send data from/to a remote device.

context.title: Sticky Note
context.description: It's a utility for creating notes on your editor.
